subject: Grounding help
description_text: I got simsonn pro plus pedals and ive dying to try them, but im unable to get them grounded and its been making the brake pedal jitter i used a usb isolator i put the pedals in a different port i put the ground cable to anything i can connect it to, and it still has jitter, cause im thinking of just returning sorry and thank you!

conversations.body_text: Hi A Barr, If this happens, it indicates that the computerâ€™s grounding is not reliable, possibly because a three-prong plug was not used with a three-prong wall outlet. You can refer to the post below: connect the computer case to the stand, and connect the control box to the metal screws on the pedals. This should resolve the disconnection issue. https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding

To make sure i understand it i connect a grounded wire to my stand and connect the grounded wire from the mini box to the pedal?

On Mon, Dec 8, 2025, 10:14 PM support @simsonn.com

Hi A Barr, Use any wire to connect three points: the PC case, the metal screw on the pedal, and the main control box. Three points are sufficient. Note that paint may affect the grounding effectiveness.

thank you so much!! i connected the copper wire to my pc psu mounting bolt to the pedal and the grounding wire for the main control box to the same bolt and extra measure i connected another to my pc case to the wheel stand and the only jittery bit is kgs but i believe thats normal yea?

On Mon, Dec 8, 2025 at 11:08 PM support @simsonn.com
i also adjusted the deadzone to5 aswell
Hi A Barr, The weight fluctuation is fine. You can go ahead and try it in the game first.
